content: your knitting around and work the first edge stitch from front to back back over the stitches you just knitted knit wrap the yarn around the needle and pull until you have worked your short row then through as for a normal knit stitch now do turn your work around so you re ready to the same for the next stitch along the edge start working back across the stitches you one row above or below just knitted 16 #woolandthegang eng to prevent holes from forming in your knitting you will work a yarn over or a reverse yarn over after you turn your work when you work back over these stitches the yarn overs will work in pairs with the stitches until you have worked back across all of the short row casting off ø online video tutorial to complete your project you need to cast off your last row of stitches in order to make an edge that won t unravel for your final row knit the first two stitches using the tip of the left needle lift the first stitch up and over the second stitch and then slip it off the right needle now you have only one stitch on your right needle knit the next stitch from the left needle then lift the previous stitch over it and off the needle as before do this with each stitch until there are no stitches on the left needle and just one stitch on the right needle cut the yarn leaving a 15 cm/6 end pull on the last loop until the ends pops through - you ve now secured the last stitch casting off in ribbing ø online video tutorial to create a stretchy edge cast off in ribbing to do this knit one stitch then purl one stitch use the tip of the left needle to lift the first stitch over the last one and off the needle knit the next stitch and lift the previous stitch over it and off the needle purl the next stitch and lift the previous stitch over it and off the needle repeat the last two stitches so that you are alternating between knit and purl stitches as you cast off how to make your wonderland hat 17 finishing techniques vertical invisible seam you have more row to sew than stitches to ø online video tutorial compensate for this insert the needle under this technique is used to join the side edges two horizontal bars on the side edge at the of two pieces place the two knitted pieces same time every third stitch side by side with the right sides up insert your sewing needle under the first horizontal bar between the first two stitches on the edge you want to join pull the yarn through and insert the needle through the opposite horizontal bar on the other piece sew back and forth through the horizontal bars along the edge to tighten the stitches pull the yarn gently
